text: Osvaldo Brandão (September 18, 1916 - July 29, 1989) was a Brazilian football manager who coached Brazil in 1955, 1956, and 1957, and from 1975 to 1977 and the Sociedade Esportiva Palmeiras in several times. Brandão was born in Taquara, Rio Grande do Sul. He also coached Cruzeiro, Palmeiras, Corinthians, São Paulo, Portuguesa, Santos,http://en.sambafoot.com/trainers/1282_Brandao.html Botafogo-SP, Portuguesa Santista, Vila Nova-GO, Independientehttp://www.clarin.com/diario/2000/12/29/d-06401.htm and Peñarol.http://girasolweb.tripod.com/tecnicos.htm == Honours == ;Palmeiras * Campeonato Paulista: 1947, 1959, 1972, 1974 * Campeonato Brasileiro Série A: 1960, 1972, 1973 ;São Paulo * Campeonato Paulista: 1971 ;Corinthians * Torneio Rio-São Paulo: 1953, 1954, 1966 * Campeonato Paulista: 1954, 1977 ;Portuguesa *Fita Azul: https:1951 ;Independiente * Argentine Primera División: 1967 ==References== Category:People from Rio Grande do Sul Category:1916 births Category:1989 deaths Category:Brazilian footballers Category:Brazilian football managers Category:Expatriate football managers in Argentina Category:Expatriate football managers in Uruguay Category:Brazilian expatriate sportspeople in Argentina Category:Brazilian expatriates in Uruguay Category:Campeonato Brasileiro Série A players Category:Campeonato Brasileiro Série A managers Category:Argentine Primera División managers Category:Uruguayan Primera División managers Category:Sport Club Internacional players Category:Sociedade Esportiva Palmeiras players Category:Sociedade Esportiva Palmeiras managers Category:Santos FC managers Category:Associação Portuguesa de Desportos managers Category:Sport Club Corinthians Paulista managers Category:Brazil national football team managers Category:Club Atlético Independiente managers Category:São Paulo FC managers Category:Peñarol managers Category:Cruzeiro Esporte Clube managers Category:Vila Nova Futebol Clube managers Category:Association footballers not categorized by position
title: Osvaldo Brandão
